verses.verse: Samson<WH8123> went down<WH3381> to Timnah,<WH8553> and saw<WH7200> a woman<WH802> in Timnah<WH8553> of the daughters<WH1323> of the Philistines.<WH6430>

He came up,<WH5927> and told<WH5046> his father<WH1> and his mother,<WH517> and said,<WH5046> "I have seen<WH7200> a woman<WH802> in Timnah<WH8553> of the daughters<WH1323> of the Philistines:<WH6430> now therefore get<WH3947> her for me as wife.<WH802>"

Then his father<WH1> and his mother<WH517> said<WH559> to him,<WH369> "Is there never a woman<WH802> among the daughters<WH1323> of your brothers,<WH251> or among all my people,<WH5971> that you go<WH1980> to take<WH3947> a wife<WH802> of the uncircumcised<WH6189> Philistines?<WH6430>" Samson<WH8123> said<WH559> to his father,<WH1> "Get<WH3947> her for me;<WH3474> for she pleases me well."

But his father<WH1> and his mother<WH517> didn't<WH3045> know that it was of Yahweh;<WH3068> for he sought<WH1245> an occasion<WH8385> against the Philistines.<WH6430> Now at that time<WH6256> the Philistines<WH6430> had rule<WH4910> over Israel.<WH3478>

Then went<WH3381> Samson<WH8123> down,<WH3381> and his father<WH1> and his mother,<WH517> to Timnah,<WH8553> and came<WH935> to the vineyards<WH3754> of Timnah:<WH8553> and behold,<WH3715> a young lion<WH738> roared<WH7580> against him.<WH7125>

The Spirit<WH7307> of Yahweh<WH3068> came mightily<WH6743> on him,<WH8156> and he tore him as he would have torn<WH8156> a young goat;<WH1423> and he had nothing<WH3972> in his hand:<WH3027> but he didn't<WH5046> tell his father<WH1> or his mother<WH517> what he had done.<WH6213>
He went down,<WH3381> and talked<WH1696> with the woman,<WH802> and she pleased<WH3474> Samson<WH8123> well.<WH3474>

After a while<WH3117> he returned<WH7725> to take<WH3947> her;<WH7725> and he turned aside<WH5493> to see<WH7200> the carcass<WH4658> of the lion:<WH738> and behold,<WH7200> there was a swarm<WH5712> of bees<WH1682> in the body<WH1472> of the lion,<WH738> and honey.<WH1706>

He took<WH7287> it into his hands,<WH3709> and went on,<WH3212> eating<WH398> as he went;<WH1980> and he came to his father<WH1> and mother,<WH517> and gave<WH5414> to them,<WH398> and they ate: but he didn't<WH5046> tell them that he had taken<WH7287> the honey<WH1706> out of the body<WH1472> of the lion.<WH738>
His father<WH1> went down<WH3381> to the woman:<WH802> and Samson<WH8123> made<WH6213> there a feast;<WH4960> for so used the young men<WH970> to do.<WH6213>
It happened,<WH7200> when they saw him,<WH3947> that they brought thirty<WH7970> companions to be with him.<WH4828>

Samson<WH8123> said<WH559> to them,<WH2330> "Let me tell you a riddle<WH2420> now.<WH5046> If you can declare<WH5046> it to me within the seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> of the feast,<WH4960> and find it out,<WH4672> then I will give<WH5414> you thirty<WH7970> linen garments<WH5466> and thirty<WH7970> changes<WH2487> of clothing;<WH899>

but if you can't<WH3201> declare<WH5046> it to me,<WH5414> then you shall give me thirty<WH7970> linen garments<WH5466> and thirty<WH7970> changes<WH2487> of clothing.<WH899>" They said<WH559> to him,<WH2330> "Put forth your riddle,<WH2420> that we may hear it.<WH8085>"

He said<WH559> to them,<WH398> "Out of the eater came forth<WH3318> food.<WH3978> Out of the strong<WH5794> came forth<WH3318> sweetness.<WH4966>" They couldn't<WH3201> in three<WH7969> days<WH3117> declare<WH5046> the riddle.<WH2420>

It happened on the seventh<WH7637> day,<WH3117> that they said<WH559> to Samson<WH8123>'s wife,<WH802> "Entice<WH6601> your husband,<WH376> that he may declare<WH5046> to us the riddle,<WH2420> lest we burn<WH8313> you and your father<WH1>'s house<WH1004> with fire.<WH784> Have you called<WH7121> us to impoverish us?<WH3423> Is it not so?"

Samson<WH8123>'s wife<WH802> wept<WH1058> before him,<WH559> and said, "You just hate<WH8130> me,<WH157> and don't love me.<WH2330> You have put forth a riddle<WH2420> to the children<WH1121> of my people,<WH5971> and haven't<WH5046> told it me.<WH5046>" He said to her,<WH559> "Behold, I haven't told it my father<WH1> nor my mother,<WH517> and shall I tell you?<WH5046>"

She wept<WH1058> before him the seven<WH7651> days,<WH3117> while their feast<WH4960> lasted:<WH1961> and it happened on the seventh<WH7637> day,<WH3117> that he told<WH5046> her,<WH6693> because she pressed him severely; and she told<WH5046> the riddle<WH2420> to the children<WH1121> of her people.<WH5971>

The men<WH582> of the city<WH5892> said<WH559> to him on the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> before the sun<WH2775> went down,<WH935> "What is sweeter<WH4966> than honey?<WH1706> What is stronger<WH5794> than a lion?<WH738>" He said<WH559> to them,<WH3884> "If you hadn't<WH2790> plowed with my heifer,<WH5697> you wouldn't<WH4672> have found out my riddle.<WH2420>"

The Spirit<WH7307> of Yahweh<WH3068> came<WH6743> mightily on him,<WH3381> and he went down to Ashkelon,<WH831> and struck<WH5221> thirty<WH7970> men<WH376> of them,<WH5221> and took their spoil,<WH2488> and gave<WH5414> the changes<WH2487> of clothing to those who declared<WH5046> the riddle.<WH2420> His anger<WH639> was kindled,<WH2734> and he went up<WH5927> to his father<WH1>'s house.<WH1004>
But Samson<WH8123>'s wife<WH802> was given to his companion,<WH4828> whom he had used as his friend.<WH7462>
